obfuscation: ﻿ Only Good Indian Is Dead Indian, and this essay 's a critical study in texts about Indians in the end in 19th century, yet i will give account for both the positive also negative views white individuals had in original inhabitants inside the United States.
original: ﻿ The Only Good Indian Is a Dead Indian. This essay is a critical study of texts about Indians in the end of the 19th century. I will give account for both the positive and negative views white people had of the original habitants of the United States.

obfuscation: view point varies a lot inside the different texts but the majority of them are written in the One thousand Eight hundred rights, and more negative attitudes towards Indians are presented inside text by walking frame; and he clearly sees them as inferior primitive human beings also inside many ways almost like animals.
original: The view point varies a lot in the different texts but most of them are written in the 1880s. The most negative attitudes towards Indians are presented in the text by Walker. He clearly sees them as inferior, primitive beings and in many ways almost like animals.

obfuscation: This is mainly shown by his notice that in the conflict between white settlers and Indians Indians are not fighting for same honorable reasons as white but rather because in their instincts.

obfuscation: They can not quite subdue the savage instincts to roam at will to defy restraint also to indulge their lawless appetite for blood also plunder.''

original: He says that the "distinguished visitors" were met with "savage discourtesy". (p.3)  Another, more positive view comes from Elisabeth B Custer. She has had many close encounters with Indians and their society and shows a lot of interest in the Indian culture.
